meanings.sent1: At her behest, the students lined up quietly.
meanings.sent2: The king's behest was law in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed at my behest, asking for more food.
meanings.sent4: The behest of the principal echoed through the school, demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: She followed his behest without question, knowing it was important.

meanings.definition: To request or urge someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: He behested his friend to help him move the heavy furniture.
meanings.sent2: She behests her dog to sit before giving him a treat.
meanings.sent3: The child behested his toy to come to life and play with him.
meanings.sent4: The wind behested the leaves to dance in the air.
meanings.sent5: The coach behested the team to give their all in the final game.
